sub_title: Project Manager at IBFD - Capacity Building, Government Consulting & Tailored Trainings
summary:
I am a multilingual and international oriented project manager, an efficient organizational talent, able to plan and manage complex projects from start to finish. I thrive on bringing organization out of chaos and leading my team and partners to successful accomplishments. I make a point of always getting things done, finding solutions by thinking out of the box and making a smart use of all resources. My way of working conveys calm and confidence, my communication style is positive and cooperative. My work experience in the field of non-profit (Academic and NGO) campaign leading, content production and project management formed me to be an excellent project manager, at ease when working within complex hierarchies and communicating within intercultural contexts.
My work experience in the field of corporate events helped me develop both strong procurement and commercial awareness, allowing me to interface with internationally based vendors and clients, and developing experience in budget sustainability.
My master studies in Italy and Canada helped develop and nurture my long held interest in global migration, trans-nationalism, expatriation and the issues which need to be addressed around these topics. 
My personal experience as an expat, living most of my adult life in several countries, has sharpened my people skills: conflict solving, constructive dialogue and diversity awareness are skills I can comfortably base my communication and interpersonal relationships on.
Last but not least, my life long passion for the performing arts, in particular theatre, has formed me to be a confident public speaker.

profile_positions.description:
At IBFD, we’ve been playing a key role in assisting governments and tax administrations to meet challenges in taxation for decades. We provide technical assistance and advice covering the total realm of taxation – policy, legislation and administration. Our services are invaluable in helping ministries of finance and tax administrations comply with international standards, carry out tax reforms and build the tax knowledge and skills of their staff.
Our independent position means you can rest assured that we are a trusted and reliable partner. We reinforce this relationship of trust by not engaging in private sector work, in order to avoid any potential conflicts of interest.
In my role as Project Manager within the Programmes Team of IBFD Tax Services Department, I am responsible for the management of capacity building training programmes for governments, from planning to implementation. As an account manager, I am also responsible for acquisition and managing accounts, both in the government and corporate sectors.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager | Capacity Building & Tailored Trainings

profile_positions.description:
IBFD Tax Services Department consists of three core business areas: International Tax Training, Tax Research Services (TRS) and the Government Consultancy. The Tax Services programme management team supports corporates with in-house trainings; it supports also governments and tax administrations around the world with technical assistance for their tax reform processes. The latter is a specialized division of professionals who work on project basis; the scope covers a wide range from policy-making to legislative and administrative issues, from capacity building to the training of staff.

Within the Tax Services Department of IBFD, I belong to the programme management team, a team of international professionals responsible for the acquisition and management of training projects for corporates and governments. Although my main focus is with projects for governments and tax authorities, I am also involved in tailored solutions for corporates.

The main tasks and responsibilities include the following:
► Project Acquisition – responsible for the acquisition of projects in the designated areas
► Account Management
► Project Management – including overseeing of the administration and logistical coordination of consultancy projects, including training activities
► Preparation of progress reports, tenders and expressions of interest for  projects
► Facilitation of effective information flow to the  management, project teams and experts
► Identification of problems and advice on project progress and budget expenditure
► Liaison with internal and external experts
► Organization of suitable human and other resources into a project environment
► Project documentation management

In addition, I am involved in various projects that contribute to the growth of the department in many aspects, such as projects with a focus on workflow efficiency and department-wide policies.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator | International Tax Training |  Tailored Training  & Government Consultancy

profile_positions.description:
Through International Tax Training (ITT), IBFD Tax Services provides standardized as well as customized training solutions for IBFD clients. It offers a wide range of courses; specialized in the field of international taxation in various locations around the world, online, as well as tailored for specific clients. ITT courses are recognized worldwide as a reputable learning platform drawing on the  expertise of the multinational IBFD research staff and external practitioners to provide a unique learning experience. 
Tasks and responsibilities include, among others:
 Managing internal and external relationships to prepare and coordinate the delivery of courses,
conferences and seminars
 Managing the on-site event process from start to finish;
 Dealing effectively and efficiently with all administrative matters;
 Representing IBFD Tax Services in a professional way when dealing with clients and instructors
profile_positions.title: Course Coordinator - Tax Services Department

profile_positions.company: Delta Amsterdam, Event Management & Destination Services
profile_positions.description:
I am a Senior Project Manager & Account Team Leader for Meetings, Incentives, Congresses and Events in The Netherlands and Benelux Region. The scale of the events varies from bookings and itineraries for individual VIPs to larger projects, such as congresses and conferences to a thousand delegates, product launches and commercial events. My clients are international companies and multinationals, looking for high end corporate incentive and business programs.
My role within the company is multiple:
- Project manager: I am in charge from start to finish of all my projects. I design custom events for my clients (destination marketing), I make sure my company gets to contract the event (sales), I oversee the contract with both client and vendors (sales and procurement), I oversee the flow of the event (operations management) and control the budget (invoicing and budge control). 
- Team leader: as a senior manager I supervise younger colleagues and lead the Italian and French market sales division.
- Sales & Marketing manager: I represent my company at trade shows, I visit clients regularly and contribute actively to the sales and marketing corporate strategy of my company.
- Procurement: I establish contact with potential vendors and close contracts with them, I establish mutual trust with existing vendors, I negotiate prices and conditions, I make sure vendors reflect the quality standards of my company, I attend events and trade shows to be updated with the latest trends of products in my field.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager & Team Leader France/Italy Account Team

profile_positions.description: I worked in the operations department as a local expert, managing and booking the itineraries in the Benelux region for the Far East Asian market. Among other tasks, I screened the itineraries that were sold by the sales agents in Asia and optimized the feasibility of the tours. I assisted sales agents with the design of the tours and updated them on all the latest trends in hospitality. My daily routine involved mainly negotiating rates and group arrangements with suppliers, advising sales agents on local tour operating best practices and controlling the tour budget allocation, as well as assist in marketing Holland as a destination.
profile_positions.title: Operations Agent Benelux

profile_positions.description: As venue scout and event consultant, I assisted clients - mostly communication agencies and NGOs - in shaping events and travel activities, by consulting on destination, budget control, logistics and serving as a procurer by liaising with venues, hotels, restaurants and staffing agencies worldwide (Netherlands, Germany, Italy, France, Spain, Canada and the US). This free lance based experienced helped me develop an international eye for venue scouting and strong procurement skills.
profile_positions.title: Event Manager & Venue Scout

profile_positions.description:
I wrote two projects for EU subventions under the Grundtvig and Matra framework (long life education). The projects were accepted and implemented. In preparation for this, I attended a workshop in Brussels, which was organised by the EU as a training for grant writing.
I was overseeing the production of written material on specific themes, in particular refugees and immigration policies, acting as an academic adviser and communications consultant.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager & Content Developer

profile_positions.description: I was an account manager for Italy and Japan. The company operated on a project basis and I represented the company on sales trips to Italy. My largest project was managing a multi-itinerary trip for a large Japanese group in the Benelux region. As a sales manager, I regularly visited clients and potential clients in Italy. As an operations manager, I was in charge of overseeing the operations schedule and liaise with vendors regularly.
profile_positions.title: Project & Account Manager (Italy and Japan Market)

profile_positions.description: I was the coordinator of the Europe-wide awareness raising campaign "The fatal realities of Fortress Europe". The network organizes two conferences per year. I assisted in the conference organized in Cyprus and I was a full member of the international preparatory group for the conference organized in Sofia, Bulgaria.I participated in the selection of delegates; I was responsible for creating the participants information package and manage the pre-conference correspondence with delegates; on site, I chaired some plenary sessions and led one working session; I was responsible for overseeing the program on site and last but not least, I was in charge of writing the final report of the conference.
profile_positions.title: Campaign Leader - Content Developer - Conference Manager

volunteer_experiences.description:
I am part of an Amsterdam-based Italian theatre company as an actress. In the last 5 years, I have acted in various roles for many productions, from Dario Fo and Franca Rame's 'Coppia Aperta Quasi Spalancata', Aristofane's 'Lisistratas', Pirandello's 'Il Berretto a Sonagli', Benni's 'Beatrici' and more.
For the production board group, I offer my professional assistance in organizing and developing productions. I assist with theatre bookings, budget management, online ticketing system development, general production logistics and social media management.
This role rounds up my involvement in the group as an actress, which is actually my hobby and the reason I joined the group in the first place. As I am a very hands-on person and I value what my professional background bring into the group, I enjoy being part of the small team managing the productions.
